item.title: M.J. add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "The actual writing is what you live for. The rest is something you have to get through in order to arrive at the point." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "We often miss opportunity because it's dressed in overalls and looks like work" -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Carl Van Doren
item.description: "Yes, it's hard to write, but it's harder not to." -- Carl Van Doren

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Harvey MacKay
item.description: "A dream is just a dream. A goal is a dream with a plan and a deadline." -- Harvey MacKay

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "So the writer who breeds more words than he needs, is making a chore for the reader who reads." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Stephen Colbert
item.description: "Researchers from Britain's Keele University have found that swearing after an injury may help alleviate pain. Evidently, the pain that you feel is inversely proportional to the number of middle names you give Jesus." -- Stephen Colbert

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Octavia Butler
item.description: "First forget inspiration. Habit is more dependable. Habit will sustain you whether you're inspired or not. Habit will help you finish and polish your stories. Inspiration won't. Habit is persistence in practice." -- Octavia Butler

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Thomas Berger
item.description: "Why do writers write? Because it isn’t there. " -- Thomas Berger

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!" -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Konrad Adenauer
item.description: "We all live under the same sky, but we don't all have the same horizon" -- Konrad Adenauer

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "Everything a writer learns about the art or craft of fiction takes just a little away from his need or desire to write at all. In the end he knows all of the tricks and has nothing to say." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "A good story cannot be devised; it has to be distilled." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Raymond Chandler
item.description: "The faster I write the better my output. If I'm going slow, I'm in trouble. It means I'm pushing the words instead of being pulled by them." -- Raymond Chandler

item.title: M.J. add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is an exploration. You start from nothing." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Anna Bayes
item.description: "No, I do not need an outrageous quest to prove my worth. I deserve happiness -- happiness on my own terms." -- Anna Bayes

item.title: M.J. add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "That's what we storytellers do. We restore order with imagination. We instill hope again and again and again." ... Walt Disney, SAVING MR. BANKS" -- Walt Disney
